title.narrative: Cote d'Ivoire - SME Revitalization and Governance Project

description.narrative: The objective of the project is to help improve the performance of the SME sector in Cote d'Ivoire and the investment climate that affects it.

title.narrative: Decrease in cost of roadside racketeering

comment.narrative: The cost based on 2008 survey was estimated to be 21.88 FCFA/tonne/Km

Based on the ENSEA study completed in 2012-2014, racketeering cost was reassessed and reduced from 21.8 FCFA/metric ton / km in2008 to 12,64FCFA/metric ton/km in 2012 and 10.2 FCFA in 2014. The overall decrease in racketeering costs registered between2010-2014 is therefore 50%, surpassing the 25% reduction target.

title.narrative: Decisions published by the Commercial Court on its website

comment.narrative: 100% of the Commercial Court decisions are published

title.narrative: P2-Number of New Jobs Generated by Registered SMEs

comment.narrative: 25K jobs are already estimated to have been created so far, with the potential of reaching 40-50K, well beyond the the 10K target.

title.narrative: Investment made by SMEs beneficiaries of the Matching Grant

comment.narrative: At end October, investments generated under this sub component correspond to 1,787,647,210 FCFA against a target of 1,877,058,656.This is equivalent to 95% of the project objective.

title.narrative: P1-Number of New SME Registered at the One Stop Shop

comment.narrative: Business registration at the newly launched CFE (one stop shop) have progressed rapidly. Project target of 1000 is largelysurpassed with around 7500 firms already registered by October 2014 as opposed to 2200 as of November 2013.

title.narrative: A1.1 Average percentage change in MFC/PME lending to SME members

comment.narrative: By project closing in October 2014, 26 credits were awarded, equivalent to an annual increase of 14.3%, surpassing the 10% targetincrease

title.narrative: Number of Days to Establish a Business

comment.narrative: The One-Stop-Shop for Business Formalities was inaugurated in December 2012. According to the DB2014 report, the number of daysrequired to register a business in Cote d’ Ivoire has decreased from 32 to 5 days. Within the 5 days, the One-Stop-Shop processesits formalities in about 48-24h. The remaining time is due to other requirements (publication in newspaper, deposit of minimumcapital inaBank, notary formalities), which bring the total to 5 days. The DB15 shows that time to register a firm at the One stopshop was further decreased to 3 days, and procedures in total equal to 7 days.

title.narrative: Number of days to make a decisions by the Commercial Court

comment.narrative: The Commercial Court of Abidjan started operations in October 2012. According to the DB2014 report, the time to settle acommercialdispute has been reduced in 2012/2013 from 770 to 585 days. The time of Trial and Judgment is reduced from 365 to 210days (within the remit of the Commercial Court), while Enforcement of Judgment (which is beyond the scope of the Commercial Court)has improved from 380 to 350 days. Filing and service time is constant at 25 days. In the latest DB report (2015) the number ofdays decreased to 525 days, with 175 days required file and judgement at the Commercial Court level, and 350 days for enforcement(outside the remit ofthe Commercial Court)
